title: Quiz 6: The Digestive System
description: Covers the gastrointestinal tract (oral cavity to anal canal), accessory organs (liver, pancreas, gallbladder), and digestive processes.

questions.question: Trace the path of food through the tubular gastrointestinal tract:
questions.explanation: Food moves from Mouth -> Pharynx -> Esophagus -> Stomach -> Small Intestine -> Large Intestine -> Rectum/Anus.

questions.question: Which of the following are considered 'Glandular' or Accessory components of the digestive system?
questions.explanation: The Stomach is part of the tubular tract. The Liver, Pancreas, Gallbladder, and Salivary glands are accessory glandular organs.
questions.hint: Organs that secrete fluids *into* the tube but aren't part of the tube itself.

questions.question: Match the type of tooth to its primary function/description:
questions.explanation: Incisors cut; Canines tear; Molars grind. Adults have 32 permanent teeth.

questions.question: Which part of the pharynx is located posterior to the oral cavity and transports both air and food?
questions.explanation: The Oropharynx is behind the mouth (Oral cavity) and handles both food and air. The Nasopharynx handles only air.

questions.question: The stomach has a volume of about ___BLANK___ liters and contains folds called ___BLANK___ that allow it to distend.
questions.explanation: The stomach can hold 2-3 liters. The mucosal folds are called Rugae (disappear when distended).

questions.question: Review the table on Stomach Secretions. What is the function of Intrinsic Factor?

richContent.content:
SecretionFunction
Acid (HCl)Medium for pepsinogen/Killing bacteria
PepsinogenProtein digestion
Intrinsic Factor???

questions.explanation: Intrinsic Factor is essential for the absorption of Vitamin B12 in the ileum.
questions.hint: Lack of this causes pernicious anemia.

questions.question: Order the segments of the Small Intestine from proximal to distal:
questions.explanation: Duodenum (10 inches) -> Jejunum (empty) -> Ileum (twisted).

questions.question: The Pancreas is solely an exocrine gland.
questions.explanation: False. The Pancreas is a **mixed** gland. Exocrine (enzymes) = 99%; Endocrine (Islets of Langerhans/Insulin) = 1%.
questions.hint: It produces insulin (endocrine) and digestive juice (exocrine).

questions.question: Which part of the Large Intestine is the Vermiform Appendix attached to?
questions.explanation: The Appendix is attached to the Caecum (the blind pouch at the beginning of the large intestine).
questions.hint: Lower right quadrant of the abdomen.

questions.question: Which of the following are lobes of the Liver?
questions.explanation: The liver has 4 lobes: Right, Left, Caudate (tail-like), and Quadrate (square).

questions.question: What is the function of the Gallbladder?
questions.explanation: The Gallbladder stores and concentrates bile produced by the liver.
questions.hint: It does NOT produce bile, only holds it.

questions.question: The Hepatic Portal Vein transports blood from the ___BLANK___ to the ___BLANK___.
questions.explanation: The Hepatic Portal Vein carries nutrient-rich blood from the digestive tract to the liver for processing before it goes to the heart.

questions.question: Match the organ to its anatomical location/description:

pairs.right: Retroperitoneal; Head in C-curve of Duodenum
Largest salivary gland; anterior to ear

questions.explanation: Esophagus is the food tube. Pancreas is behind the stomach (retroperitoneal). Liver is top right. Parotid is by the ear.

questions.question: The Hard Palate is located posteriorly and is a movable fibromuscular fold.
questions.explanation: False. The **Hard Palate** is bony and anterior. The **Soft Palate** is the movable fibromuscular fold located posteriorly.

questions.question: Order the flow of bile from the liver to the duodenum:

items.text: Common Bile Duct (joined by Cystic Duct)

questions.explanation: Liver -> Hepatic Ducts -> Common Hepatic -> Joined by Cystic -> Common Bile Duct -> Ampulla -> Duodenum.
questions.hint: Hepatic means Liver; Cystic means Bladder (Gallbladder).

questions.question: Which sphincter controls the exit of food (chyme) from the stomach into the duodenum?
questions.explanation: The Pyloric sphincter is at the distal end of the stomach (Pylorus). The Cardiac sphincter is at the entry.

questions.question: Which of the following are parts of the Large Intestine?
questions.explanation: The Ileum is part of the Small Intestine. The Large Intestine includes Caecum, Colon (Asc, Trans, Desc, Sigmoid), Rectum.

questions.question: The ___BLANK___ is the slit-like space between the lips/cheeks and the teeth/gums.
questions.explanation: The Vestibule is the entry space. The Mouth Proper is the space behind the teeth.
questions.hint: Like the 'vestibule' or entrance hall of a building.

questions.question: Which of the following teeth are described as 'single-rooted' and used for biting?
questions.explanation: Incisors are the front teeth (4) used for cutting/biting.

questions.question: Swallowing (deglutition) is entirely a voluntary process.
questions.explanation: False. Swallowing starts voluntarily (tongue moves bolus), but once it hits the pharynx, it becomes an involuntary reflex.
questions.hint: Can you stop swallowing halfway through?
